line_1: Some fly, like pendulums, from good to evil,
line_2: And in that point are madder than the devil:

line_1: Tho' wrong, she knew he meant no evil,
line_2: And thought he was exceeding civil,

line_1: In a world so abounding with evil,
line_2: As to wage open war with the devil,

line_1: In Color, way of life and evil,
line_2: Sould be so very like the Devil.

line_1: Alike the instrument of good and evil,
line_2: The attribute of God and of the Devil.
And send it packing to the Devil;

line_1: Prone were his eyes to earth, his mind to evil,
line_2: The mongrel offspring of a Witch and Devil.

line_1: Well; guard us all, I say, from evil!
line_2: For mighty watchful is the Devil."
